result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle L Bohn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Program.
2 days credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
$250.00 BAIL APPLIED. Balance of Costs/DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
9/22/2016 - IT IS UP TO THE AGENT'S DISCRETION IF THE DEFENDANT IS TO WORK IN AN ENVIRONMENT WHERE ANY TYPE OF LIQUOR OR ALCOHOL IS SERVED.  THE COURT ALSO GRANTS RELEASE FOR APPOINTMENTS DEALING WITH FAMILY COURT.

timeConds.notes:
First 8 months served as STRAIGHT TIME. Remaining 4 months non working hours (huber) Commence FORTHWITH.
9/22/2016 - COURT GRANTS THE REQUEST FOR THE DEFENDANT TO SERVE THE BALANCE OF HER CONDITION TIME WITH NON-WORKING HOURS WITH HUBER PRIVILEGES COMMENCING OCTOBER 8, 2016.
6 Months of Day Report Center to run consecutive to Condition Time.
***10/28/2016 COURT GRANTS RELEASE FROM HUBER FOR UP TO 14 HOURS PER DAY FOR EMPLOYMENT UNTIL 12/08/2016. THEN BALANCE OF SENTENCE TO BE CONVERTED TO THE DAY REPORT PROGRAM.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Michelle L Bohn in court with attorney Chris Bailey.   
Court to Address - Defense request for sentence modification - (Defense Requests to convert the balance of the defendant's condition time to Electronic Monitoring or Day Report Program).

Atty. Bailey presented arguments to the court.
State objects to any sentence modification and presented arguments.

Court denies the defense request for Electronic Monitoring.
Court will amend the sentence as follow:
Continue with Huber time until 12/08/16.
Court will specifically authorize release from huber for up to 14 hours per day due to her employment.
As of 12/08/16 the balance of the huber time will be converted to Day Report Program.
Everything else remains as previously ordered.
Amended JOC to be prepare.
Review hearing on October 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.

From defendant dated 10/18/16 requesting a hearing.

Denying electronic monitoring signed by Judge Aprahamian 10/17/16.

From defendant dated 10/13/16 requesting electronic monitoring. 
Reviewed by Judge Aprhamian 10/14/16; Denied as not in the interests of justice.

Defendant Michelle L Bohn in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bailey requests the Court allow the Defendant to work in an environment where alcohol is served and requests the Court grant the Huber privileges forthwith including release for appointments dealing with family court.   The State objects to the modification.  The Court orders as follows:  It is up to the agents discretion if the Defendant is to work in an environment where any type of liquor or alcohol is served.   The Court grants the request for the Defendant to serve the balance of her condition time  with non-working hours with Huber privileges commencing October 8, 2016.
Review hearing on September 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Michelle L Bohn in court with attorney Chris Bailey.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Counts #2, #3 and #4 are dismissed and read into Count #1.  The Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report be filed within 45 days no later than January 15, 2016.  Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program today.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.

Attorney Bailey requests that the Defendant be placed on the SCRAM bracelet.    The Court orders that the Defendant remain on the SCRAM bracelet.   The Court quashes sets cash bond @ $250.00 cash as well as wearing SCRAM.  Reinstates signature bond.  The case will proceed to plea at next hearing.
